diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a two-month history of intermittent right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and nausea after meals, which worsened and became constant. Physical examination revealed RUQ tenderness and + CVAT on the right side. An abdominal ultrasound showed gallstones in the gallbladder without signs of gallbladder dilatation, wall edema, or pericholecystic fluid, pointing towards acute cholecystitis.
